title: Users report slowness
when: Use this when the service works, but feels slow.
goal: Confirm the slowdown is real, determine who is affected, and reduce impact quickly.
steps: Confirm the time window: when did users first notice it?
Check if the issue is limited (one region/site) or widespread.
Look for a clear signal: increased delay or errors during the same period.
If limited to one path/region, shift traffic or prefer the healthier route (demo: document the action).
Verify improvement: compare before vs after for at least 10 minutes.
Post a plain-English update with what users might notice and when the next update will be.
escalate: Escalate if impact expands to multiple regions, errors rise, or performance doesn’t recover after the first mitigation attempt.
stakeholder_message: We’re seeing slower performance for a subset of users. We’ve reduced the impact and are monitoring stability. Next update in 15 minutes.

title: Site appears unreachable
when: Use this when users cannot reach the service at all.
goal: Confirm whether this is a real outage and restore access as fast as possible.
steps: Confirm the symptom: can users reach the service from at least two different locations?
Identify scope: one site/region or global?
Check for a sharp spike in failures or drops.
If it’s isolated, route around the impacted segment (demo: document the decision + evidence).
If it’s widespread, escalate immediately and publish a short status notice.
Confirm recovery and keep monitoring until stable.
escalate: Escalate immediately if the issue appears global or if multiple services are affected.
stakeholder_message: We’re investigating an access issue affecting some users. We’re working to restore service and will provide the next update shortly.

title: Intermittent failures (retries work)
when: Use this when failures come in bursts and users can sometimes retry successfully.
goal: Separate noise from real instability and prevent repeated customer disruption.
steps: Confirm this is intermittent: do failures appear in bursts rather than continuous?
Determine if failures cluster around a specific site/path/route.
Check whether the failure bursts align to a change window or known event.
Apply a safe mitigation (route preference / reduce use of unstable path).
Watch for recurrence for at least 30 minutes.
Write a short RCA note if the pattern repeats.
escalate: Escalate if bursts become continuous, or if the affected area expands beyond the initial cluster.
stakeholder_message: We’re seeing brief, intermittent failures for a subset of users. We’ve applied a mitigation to reduce impact and are monitoring for recurrence.
